we all know bioshock serie ; so i get straight into it.

*If you did not played first 2 game of the serie first play them.
*No more bellow zero , we're goin to sky.
*They keep the serie alive in interesting level.
*Good storyline.
*Enjoyable game.
*Amazing Atmosphere.
*Elizabeth kips kips.

9/10 Graphics , alive colors , atmosphere and graphics so connected well done. (UNREAL ENGINE 3.)
9/10 Maps , i loved when i was amazed when i see sky city , i was tryin to check every corner and discover it.
9/10 Design , lovely designs , amazing lookin texture and connected thru both atmosphere and bioshockstyle
8/10 Mechanics , Enjoyable mechanics , it will feel like old if you play now but , deff somethin u had to try.
8/10 CharImprove , basicly you just improve your stuff like health bar etc. cool adding but simple.
8/10 Balance , you improve , your enemies get stronger as well.
6/10 AI , They did not really improve it but they're slightly better.at least they take position LOL.
8/10 Animations , yea cool & sometimes cute stuff ah elizabeth my ex lmao wtf dont read rest.
8/10 Gameplay , Good gameplay i love the fact this game even tho seem like simple kept the feelin of gameplay interestingly good so you will be probly not bored while you play.
10/10 Storyline , this is the actual reason you will play this game , mark my word you will love it.
1/10 Bugs , i mean i did not see many bugs even tho some people encounter a lot , but i did not so i say nah.

so far and overall i will suggest story lovers out there , if you never played first 2 games first play 1&2 then play infinite i would recommend entire serie.

Chances are, if you're reading this, you might be an individual new to the Bioshock franchise (never played it before but have heard of it) and are considering buying this game (and possibly other Bioshock games) because it was on sale. 

That is exactly what I did and let me tell you- buying this was one of the best gaming choices I have made in my entire life.

Everything in this game from the solid gameplay and captivating story just keeps me wanting more. To say that this game is a BLAST is a gross understatement. If you have never played this game before, I HIGHLY recommend it. I can pretty much guarantee that you'll have the time of your life. Instant classic right here.

P.S: Try not to simp for Elizabeth too hard, buddy.

BIOSHOCK Infinite - ABSOLUTE SPIELEMPFEHLUNG !
 (Spielzeit incl. der 3 DLC´s Burial at Sea und Clash in the  clouds): 60 h; PC; alte Orginal-Fassung)

 --> meine Empfehlung, vorher BS 1 und BS 2 spielen. Sie sind sich sehr ähnlich, sie finden in der gleichen Unterwasserwelt statt, und sie sind vom Ambiente eher düster.
 (Siehe auch meine anderen Rezension )

BIOSHOCK INFINITE ist vom Ambiente komplett anders, anfangs eher hell und heiter. Die Welt ist so schön, Musik passend dazu, - da bleibt der Mund schon mal offen.... 
Dennoch ist INFINITE mit den beiden Vorgängern in vielerlei Hinsicht verbunden - insbesondere durch die beiden ausgezeichneten DLC´s (Burial at Sea 1 und 2).
Was soll man sonst sagen ... Eine Stadt über den Wolken, - unbeschreiblich, überwältigend.
Und das Wichtigste:

                                                          ! ELISABETH !

 Eine der liebenswertesten und KI-technisch top gemachten Begleitfiguren, deren Aktionen den Spieler öfters mal zum Schmunzeln bringt, Ihre Biographie jedoch manch Einen von uns "harten Kämpfern" auch zu feuchten Augen rühren kann. - INFINITE ist EMOTIONAL wie die beiden Vorgänger. 
Die Handlung wird zeitweise kompliziert, - man kann bei der Multiversum-Theorie schon mal den Faden verlieren, aber das Spiel holt uns kurz darauf sicher wieder zurück auf Spur.
Gegen Ende das Sahnestückchen (Mini-SPOILER!) für alle Fans - Ihr werdet RAPTURE wiedersehen, yeahhh...
Wünsche Ihnen viel Spaß damit, - Booker DeWitt !
Gönn dir einfach, ist halt nice, Brudi. #wouldyoukindly

This was by far one of the best single player experiences I've ever had, the story is amazing and you get attached to some amazing characters! Would 100% recommend this to anyone and the graphics/style of the game is beyond others even in 2020. I'm gutted I've finished and don't know how to feel from the ending; sad, shocked, amazed etc.

(Also, just seen this game is on sale at £4.99 at the moment and full price is £19.99!!!) It's a win, win either way for me, definitely worth the price of that!

Its like a loop kill a multiple rooms of enemies ,loot up and you get a little bit of story. The game isnt for me ,but still I finished it and the finale was really good made. But after all I think its overrated.

It is really different than the two previous games in the franchise but it is still a great game with an amazing setting and an engaging storyline. However, I find the gameplay, although much more fast-paced, is a little bit dumbed down compared to the claustrophobic, strategic nature of the first two games. Nonetheless, it is still recommended for those who like the franchise and FPS in general. We need the fourth game as soon as possible please, Irrational Games.

BioShock Infinite is a game that has aged very well. Visuals are really pretty and the lighting is pleasing to look at. The story is can be confusing and convoluted at times since talking a lot about alternate universes and timelines (try not to overthink it) but nonetheless I had a blast playing through it and once again like typical BioShock fashion it has a very nice plot twist. It can feel clunky or rather stiff while playing but nothing game breaking in my experience. One of the best parts of the game is definitely the character interactions and voice acting, and can sometimes even feel pretty cinematic. Depending on the difficulty you choose the enemies in the game can feel like bullet sponges and requires good use of your plasmids.. I mean vigors. Some weapons like the sniper rifle take more time to get used to because of how non-fluid it feels while other weapons are just overpowered. All said, BioShock Infinite is a great addition to this franchise and I would absolutely recommend playing it if you are a fan of the series to get the full experience.
Amazing level design and character building. Combat is same ol bioshock combat, nothing insane nothing too bad. Story is interesting and engaging. Super solid ~11ish hours of gameplay

    The main game was pretty weak most of the times but with occasional bright moments.
    The DLCs are a pain to play because of the costant change in mechanics but they absolutely shine like the main game rarely did.
I was skeptical at first, then annoyed, then intrigued, then pissed, then intrigued again. The DLCs came in the equation and completing the circle is just so powerful, even more when i played all the saga in one go and it was still fresh in my mind so i could see the references and the parallelism.
Not the game it could have been but if you factor all together it is still a very solid story and i absolutely recommend grabbing them on the cheap.

这居然是13年的游戏。。。飞上天空之城的那一刹那真是太震撼了
当之无愧的第九艺术，前无古人后也难有来者，神作。惊艳的开头展现了一个绝美的伊甸——天空之城哥伦比亚，暗藏着和其他天堂一样的恐怖，生物机械，平行世界，宗教与革命种种元素讲了最艺术最科幻的故事，在短短十几个小时里震撼你的身心。随后被戛然而止的结局带上高潮，一遍遍的思考什么是命运，什么是时空，什么是无限。短小精悍的单机游戏巅峰，让人久久不能自已。

The most intense, engaging and emotional game I've experienced in years. My only regret is coming to this game so late.
Some of the "levels" can be a little bit tricky to wrap your head around, due to the nature of traversing Colombia, but those moments are few and never game-breaking. Only really an issue for those of us compelled to explore every nook and cranny.
The Vigors that replace the Plasmids of the first two games don't feel as... crucial. I barely used them for most of my playthrough, often forgetting I had them. The pace of this game is quicker and, as such, firearms tend to get you further.
The story is where this game really shines, it's truly incredible. It never felt like it was dragging, like I said the pace is pretty quick and it keeps your attention throughout. This is not the kind of game where you often find yourself forgetting your objective, your overall purpose. Instead it drives you consistently and keeps you invested.
This is greatly aided by the superb voice acting and animations of the important characters. Unlike previous Bioshock games, whose cutscenes tended to feel a little wooden and relied more upon the various audio diaries scattered throughout the world, the NPCs feel alive and the frequent "quiet drama sections" tend to be the more enjoyable parts, as more of this narrative gets pieced together.
All in all, great game. 10/10, if you love narrative single player experiences you can't go wrong here.
